body_html:
c:\python35\scripts\pip3 install PythonWheels/tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl
tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.

What could cause this error?

Is it compiling on Windows 10 rather than Windows 7? What version of Windows is your CI build server?

Could it be a difference in the CMake flags?

Yours (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/gpu/cmake/run_build.bat):
%CMAKE_EXE% %CMAKE_DIR% -A x64 -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=%SWIG_EXE% -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%PY_EXE% -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=%PY_LIB% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME=%CUDNN_HOME% -Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%

Mine:
cmake C:\Users\Kevin\dev\tensorflow-r1.4\tensorflow\contrib\cmake -A x64 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=C:/Users/Kevin/dev/swigwin-3.0.12/swig.exe -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/python.exe -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/libs/python36.lib -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\include -DNUMPY_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\include -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME="C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v8.0" -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX

In yours but not mine:

  • -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS%
  • -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS%
  • -Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%

In mine but not yours:

  • -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX

Your MSBuild:
%MSBUILD_EXE% /p:Configuration=Release /maxcpucount:32 /verbosity:minimal tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj

Mine. I don't see any substantive difference:
MSBuild /p:Configuration=Release tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj
body_text:
c:\python35\scripts\pip3 install PythonWheels/tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl
tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.

What could cause this error?
Is it compiling on Windows 10 rather than Windows 7?  What version of Windows is your CI build server?
Could it be a difference in the CMake flags?
Yours (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/gpu/cmake/run_build.bat):
%CMAKE_EXE% %CMAKE_DIR% -A x64 -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=%SWIG_EXE% -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%PY_EXE% -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=%PY_LIB% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME=%CUDNN_HOME% -Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%
Mine:
cmake C:\Users\Kevin\dev\tensorflow-r1.4\tensorflow\contrib\cmake -A x64 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=C:/Users/Kevin/dev/swigwin-3.0.12/swig.exe -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/python.exe -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/libs/python36.lib -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\include -DNUMPY_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\include -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME="C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v8.0" -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX 
In yours but not mine:

-Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS%
-Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS%
-Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%

In mine but not yours:

-Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX

Your MSBuild:
%MSBUILD_EXE% /p:Configuration=Release /maxcpucount:32 /verbosity:minimal tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj
Mine.  I don't see any substantive difference:
MSBuild /p:Configuration=Release tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj
body:
```
c:\python35\scripts\pip3 install PythonWheels/tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl
tensorflow_gpu-1.4.0rc1-cp36-cp36m-win_amd64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.
```

What could cause this error?  

Is it compiling on Windows 10 rather than Windows 7?  What version of Windows is your CI build server?

Could it be a difference in the CMake flags?

Yours (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/gpu/cmake/run_build.bat):
`%CMAKE_EXE% %CMAKE_DIR% -A x64 -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=%SWIG_EXE% -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=%PY_EXE% -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=%PY_LIB% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS% -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME=%CUDNN_HOME% -Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%`

Mine:
`cmake C:\Users\Kevin\dev\tensorflow-r1.4\tensorflow\contrib\cmake -A x64 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=C:/Users/Kevin/dev/swigwin-3.0.12/swig.exe -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/python.exe -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES=C:/ProgramData/Anaconda3/libs/python36.lib -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\include -DNUMPY_INCLUDE_DIR=C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\include -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_GPU=ON -DCUDNN_HOME="C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v8.0" -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX `

In yours but not mine:
- -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=%BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS% 
- -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=%BUILD_CC_TESTS% 
- -Dtensorflow_TF_NIGHTLY=%TF_NIGHTLY%

In mine but not yours:
- -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX  

Your MSBuild:
`%MSBUILD_EXE% /p:Configuration=Release /maxcpucount:32 /verbosity:minimal tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj`

Mine.  I don't see any substantive difference:
`MSBuild /p:Configuration=Release tf_python_build_pip_package.vcxproj`
